alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West; Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 26 at 2:02PM PST until December 28 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO 3 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...Western portion of Joshua Tree National Park and Western Imperial County. * WHEN...From noon Monday to 3 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult handling conditions due to the strong winds, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Patchy blowind dust will also be possible causing suddenly reduced visibility. Affected roadways include, but are not limited to, I-8 and Highway 86.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West; Joshua Tree NP West
